page.title: 19SHEEP FARMING - HORTON KIRBY
page.content: The shepherd is typical of the farm workers in this area, son following father and wives working on the farm. He started at 14, working with, and being trained by his father. He always uses 2 dogs, one young and one older that respond to whistle and word commands. He and his family live in a farm cottage and his wife works on the farm. Modern methods and the use of innoculation have improved the health and quality of the herd. Ewes are fitter, often producing triplets. Sheltered lambing pens, heat lamps and intravenous drips have increased the percentage of live births. Both meat and wool yield have increased - lambs weighing 19 kilos at 12 weeks are sold in French markets, mutton goes to Europe and India, and the wool is used in the Tweed industry
